lines.line: Function NetPay(varGross As Double, varFederal As Double, varState As Double, varInsurance As Double) As Double
lines.comment: Declare a global function that accepts four variables: Gross income, Federal Tax, State Tax, and Insurance, and returns the net pay
Calculate the net pay by subtracting the percentage remaining after tax deduction, and then subtracting the cost of insurance
Start the error processing IF clause: if NetPay is negative, there must be some error in data entry
If NetPay is negative, we change it to 0
If NetPay is negative, display a message saying that there is an invalid data entry
End the IF clause
End the function
End the Module code

lines.line: 'Put 5, 7 or 14 in Shipping Cost text box depending whether the shipping type is Ground, Priority or Express
Private Sub cbxShipping_SelectedIndexChanged(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles cbxShipping.SelectedIndexChanged
lines.comment: This procedure is generated by VB, it runs when a user changes the item he or she is viewing in the combo box
This statement checks if user selected ground shipping in Shipping combo box
If ground shipping was selected, we are going to charge $5 and so we record 5 in the text box txtShipCost
This alternative IF statement activates if the previous IF was false; it checks if user selected priority shipping in Shipping combo box
If priority shipping was selected, $7 will be charged and so we record 7 in the text box txtShipCost
In all other cases (not Ground and not Priority)...
Record 14 in the text box txtShipCost
Finish the IF clause
Add the amount charged for shipping with the order cost and the tax and record it in the text box txtTotal
End procedure

lines.line: 'Calculate the total order cost based on product cost, tax, and shipping type
Private Sub cbxQuantity_SelectedIndexChanged(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles cbxQuantity.SelectedIndexChanged
lines.comment: Recalculate the total cost of the order every time user changes product quantity in the combo box cbxQuantity
Calculate the order cost by multiplying product price by the quantity, and record it in the text box txtOrderCost
Calculate the tax amount (7% of the order cost) and record it in the text box txtTax
Add the order cost, the tax amount, and the shipping cost, and record the result in the text box txtTotal
End the combo box _Change clause

Declare a variable that will loop through the rows
Declare a variable that will loop through the columns
Initialize the number of green cells by assigning 0
The following statements will be executed WITH the object Excel
Start a loop by rows
Start inner loop by columns
If a cell color is green (colorindex = 50) then execute the following
Increment the number of green cells by 1
End the IF clause
Do next inner loop
Do next outer loop
End WITH clause
End the function
